_AdaptiveProvisioningPeer_.description: A provisioning peer consumes and/or produces adaptive journal entries.

advanceCursor.description: This property set by get_entry() option advance_cursor_for_consumer. If set, get_entry() option next_for_consumer will removed it and use it as the cursor to begin looking for the next applicable entry. The intent of cursorNext is to be set by a background process/thread that examines journal entries from the cursorNext/cursorCurrent forward looking for a entry that passes the consumer filter. Once cursorNext is used by get_entry() next_for_consumer, the property is removed.
advanceCursor.title: Advance Cursor

consumeCursor.description: This is the current cursor being consumed. This property only exists between a get_entry() option next_for_consumer and the corresponding mark_entry_consumed(). If this property exists, it should have exactly the same value as property cursorCurrent. Anything else is and error.
consumeCursor.title: Consume Cursor

consumeFilter.description: This is a boolean expression that determines if a journal entry is applicable to be consumed by this peer.
consumeFilter.title: Consume Filter

consumeStartTime.description: The time that get_entry() next_for_consumer began. This property will only exist if cursorBeingConsumed property exists.
consumeStartTime.title: Consume Start Time

currentCursor.description: This is the current cursor into the journal.
currentCursor.title: Current Cursor

lastContactTime.description: The last time the peer was successfully contacted.
lastContactTime.title: Last Contact Time

peerId.description: Id used to identify this peer. This may also be referred to as the consumerId or producerId, depending on the perspective.
peerId.title: Peer
